sen.j: 松井山手駅（まついやまてえき）は、京都府京田辺市山手中央にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）片町線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Yamate-Chuo, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, Matsuiyamate Station is a stop on the Katamachi Line, whichis operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Matsuiyamate Station, located in Yamate-Chuo, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Matsuiyamate Station, located in Yamate-Chuo, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA/J-through cards can be used in this station.
ICOCA/J-through cards can be used in this station.
ICOCA/J-through cards can be used in this station.

sen.j: ICOCAの相互利用対象であるSuica、TOICA、PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: Suica, TOICA and PiTaPa (by SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION), all of which can be used interchangeably with ICOCA, can also be used.
Suica, TOICA and PiTaPa (by SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) can all be used, and all interchangeably with ICOCA.
Suica, TOICA and PiTaPa (by SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION), which are mutually usable with ICOCA, can also be used.
sen.cmt: 表現を他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 各駅停車のほとんどがここで折り返す。
sen.e: Almost all of the local trains return from this station.
Nearly all the local trains return from this station.
Nearly all the local trains return from this station.

sen.j: 快速列車は木津駅 (京都府)～松井山手～長尾駅_(大阪府)間の各駅に停車する。
sen.e: The rapid trains stop at Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture), Matsuiyamate Station and Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture)
The rapid trains stop at Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture), Matsuiyamate Station and Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture).
The rapid trains stop at Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture), Matsuiyamate Station and Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 以前はここで編成の一部の増解結が行われていたが、2002年3月からは京田辺駅で行われている。
sen.e: Before, car-connecting/disconnecting work was conducted in this station, but the work became to be conducted in Kyotanabe Station.
Previously, the work of connecting and disconnecting cars was conducted in this station, but eventually the work was conducted at Kyotanabe Station.
Previously, the work of connecting and disconnecting cars was conducted in this station, but eventually the work has been conducted at Kyotanabe Station since March, 2002.

sen.j: 駅周辺で京阪東ローズタウンを開発している京阪電気鉄道が建設費を負担した請願駅である（湖西線の小野駅 (滋賀県)も同様）。
sen.e: It is a station whose construction was requested by people and whose constuction cost was burdened by Keihan Electric Railway, which has developed Keihan East Rose Town around the station (Ono Station on Kosei Line (Shiga Prefecture) was also built likewise).

It's a station whose construction was requested by people and whose construction cost was borne by Keihan Electric Railway, which has developed Keihan East Rose Town around the station (Ono Station on the Kosei Line (Shiga Prefecture) was built through a similar process).

It's a station whose construction was requested by people and whose construction cost was borne by Keihan Electric Railway, which has developed Keihan East Rose Town around the station (Ono Station on the Kosei Line (Shiga Prefecture) was built through a similar process).

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ堀割駅で橋上駅がある。
sen.e: It is a trench-type station (in which railway tracks are placed in a trench), with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, and its station house is placed over the tracks.
It is a trench-type station (in which railway tracks are placed in a trench), with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, and its station house is placed over the tracks.
It is a trench-type station (in which railway tracks are placed in a trench), with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, and its station house is placed over the tracks.

sen.j: 当駅から木津方面が単線となっているため、交換可能駅としての機能も持つ。
sen.e: Since only a single track is provided on the Kizu side of this station, it is also provided with the function to switch the trains that use the single track..
Because only a single track is provided on the Kizu side of the station, it's also provided with the function to switch the trains that use the single track.
Because only a single track is provided from this station to the direction of Kizu, it's also provided with the function to switch the trains that use the single track.
sen.cmt: 文頭の表現を一部変更しました。

sen.j: 大阪府との境界に近い丘陵地にあるため、線路およびホームは掘割の中にある。
sen.e: Because this station is located in a hilly area near to the border with Osaka Prefecture, the tracks and platforms are placed in a trench.
However, since this station is located in a hilly area near the border with Osaka Prefecture, the tracks and platforms are placed in a trench.
Since this station is located in a hilly area near the border with Osaka Prefecture, the tracks and platforms are placed in a trench.

sen.j: 両ホームにエレベーターが設置されている。
sen.e: An elevator is installed on each of the platforms.
An elevator is installed on each of the platforms.
An elevator is installed on each of the platforms.

sen.j: 321系の運用は当駅までである。
sen.e: The 321-series trains are operated up to this station.
The 321 Series trains are operated up to this station.
The 321 Series trains are operated up to this station.

sen.j: なお、当駅はジェイアール西日本交通サービスによる業務委託駅である。
sen.e: The operation of this station is entrusted to JR West Kotsu Service.
The operation of this station is entrusted to JR West Kotsu Service.
The operation of this station is entrusted to JR West Kotsu Service.

sen.j: 主として1番線に木津方面行き（上り）、2番線に京橋方面行き（下り）が発着するが、時間帯や当駅折り返し列車の発着番線によって、適宜発着ホームが変更される（ラッシュ時の折り返し京橋方面行きの大半は1番線に発着）。
sen.e: Mainly, track 1 is used for (up-)trains going in the direction of Kizu Station and track 2 for (down-)trains going in the direction of Kyobashi Station, but the tracks where trains arrive at or depart from are changed depending on the time zone or on which tracks returning trains use (most of the trains returing in the direction of Kyobashi arrive at and depart from track 1).

Mainly, track 1 is used for up trains going in the direction of Kizu Station and track 2 is used for down trains going in the direction of Kyobashi Station, but the tracks on which trains arrive or depart are changed depending on the time zone or on which tracks the returning trains use (most of the trains returning in the direction of Kyobashi arrive at and depart from track 1).

Mainly, Platform 1 is used for inbound trains going in the direction of Kizu Station and Platform 2 is used for outbound trains going in the direction of Kyobashi Station, but the tracks on which trains arrive or depart are changed depending on the time zone or on which tracks the returning trains use (most of the trains returning in the direction of Kyobashi arrive at and depart from Platform 1).
sen.cmt: 上り→inbound, 下り→outbound としました。

sen.j: 日中の場合、かつては木津方面へ発着する快速列車（上下線双方）を1番線、当駅折り返しの各駅停車を2番線に発着させるダイヤであったが、現在は当駅で木津方面発着列車同士の行き違いを行うようになったため、昼間時は事実上行き先がホームごとに固定された形になっている。
sen.e: In the day time, the rapid trains going to/coming from the direction of Kizu Station (both up-trains and down-trains) used, in the past, track 1, with local trains returning from this station using track 2, but because trains going to/coming from the direction of Kizu Station has become to meet here, each platform is fixed, in the day time, to use of the trains running only in one direction.

In the daytime, the rapid trains going to/coming from the direction of Kizu Station (both up trains and down trains) formerly used track 1, with local trains returning from this station using track 2, but because trains going to/coming from the direction of Kizu Station have come to meet here, each platform is fixed, in the daytime, to the use of the trains running in only one direction.

In the daytime, the rapid trains going to/coming from the direction of Kizu Station (both inbound trains and outbound trains) formerly used Platform 1, with local trains returning from this station using Platform 2, but because trains going to/coming from the direction of Kizu Station have come to meet here, each platform is fixed, in the daytime, to the use of the trains running in only one direction.
sen.cmt: 上り→inbound, 下り→outbound としました。Track→Platform に変更しました。

sen.j: 木津方に引き上げ線1本があり、朝ラッシュ時の列車折り返しと夜間の列車留置に使われている。
sen.e: A side-track is provided in the direction of Kizu and is usde for changing the direction of the returning trains and for keeping trains in the night.
A side track is provided in the direction of Kizu and is used to change the direction of the returning trains and to store trains in the nighttime hours.
A side track is provided in the direction of Kizu and is used to change the direction of the returning trains and to store trains in the nighttime hours.

sen.j: ダイヤが乱れた場合の列車留置に使われることもあるが、接続しているのが2番線だけのため十分に活用できないこともある。
sen.e: The side-track is sometimes used for keeping trains when the train schedule is desruptted, but it cannot be used fully since it is connected only to track 2.
The side track is sometimes used to keep trains when the train schedule is disrupted, but it can't be used fully since it's connected only to Track 2.
The side track is sometimes used to keep trains when the train schedule is disrupted, but it can't be used fully since it's connected only to Platform 2.

sen.j: 京阪東ローズタウン
sen.e: Keihan East Rose Town
Keihan East Rose Town
Keihan East Rose Town

sen.j: 松井ヶ丘・大住ヶ丘
sen.e: Matsuigaoka and Osumigaoka
Matsuigaoka and Osumigaoka

sen.j: 京田辺松井山手郵便局
sen.e: The Kyotanabe Matsuiyamate post office
The Kyotanabe Matsuiyamate post office
The Kyotanabe Matsuiyamate post office

sen.j: 松井ヶ丘・大住ヶ丘公園
sen.e: The Matsuigaoka park and the Osumigaoka park
The Matsuigaoka and Osumigaoka parks
The Matsuigaoka and Osumigaoka parks

sen.j: 国道1号
sen.e: National Highway 1
National Highway 1
National Route 1
sen.cmt: 国道→national route としました。

sen.j: 第二京阪道路
sen.e: The Second Keihan national highway
The Second Keihan National Highway
The Second Keihan National Highway

sen.j: 諏訪ヶ原公園
sen.e: Suwagahara Park
Suwagahara Park
Suwagahara Park

sen.j: 京田辺市立松井ヶ丘小学校
sen.e: Kyotanabe City-run Matsuigaoka Elementary School
Matsuigaoka Elementary School, run by Kyotanabe City
Matsuigaoka Elementary School, Kyotanabe City
sen.cmt: run by を削除し、表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 駅前には京阪バスのバスロータリーがある。
sen.e: A traffic circle used by buses of Keihin Bus is located in front of the station.
A traffic circle used by the buses of Keihin Bus is located in front of the station.
A traffic circle used by the buses of Keihin Bus is located in front of the station.

sen.j: なお、一時期は旧京阪宇治交通において「リムジンセンターU-ハウス学研山手」という停留所名だった。
sen.e: For a period of time in the past, the stop was named "U-house limosuine center/Gakken Yamate."
For a period of time in the past, the stop was called the "U-house limousine center/Gakken Yamate."
For a period of time in the past, the stop was called the 'U-house limousine center/Gakken Yamate.'

sen.j: 現在、近畿日本鉄道新田辺駅行きの便が頻発、樟葉駅行きも大きく分けて3路線が主に運行されている。
sen.e: Now, buses for Shin-Tanabe Station of Kintetsu Railways depart frequently form this stop, and three main routes are operated for Kuzuha Station as well.
Now, buses for Shin-Tanabe Station of Kintetsu Railways make frequent departures from this stop, and three main routes are operated for Kuzuha Station as well.
Now, buses for Shin-Tanabe Station of Kintetsu Railways make frequent departures from this stop, and three main routes are operated for Kuzuha Station as well.

sen.j: 前者には大住駅、健康村を経由する路線(63)と、畠を経由する路線（68・31）、および茶屋前から稲葉を経由する路線（31・31A・65・67・67B・67D）がそれぞれあり、また本数は少ないが京田辺市役所へ向かう路線(65)もある。
sen.e: For Shintanabe Station, route 63 via kenkomura (the health village), routes 68/81 via Hata, and routes 31/31A/65/67/67B/67D via Inaba through Chayamae are provided, and route 65 for the Kyotanabe city office is also provided, although operated not so frequently.

For Shintanabe Station, Route 63 via Kenkomura (the health village), routes 68/81 via Hata, and routes 31/31A/65/67/67B/67D via Inaba through Chayamae are provided, and Route 65 for the Kyotanabe city office is also provided, although it doesn't operate very frequently.

For Shin-Tanabe Station, Route 63 via Kenkomura (the health village), routes 68/31 via Hata, and routes 31/31A/65/67/67B/67D via Inaba through Chayamae are provided, and Route 65 for the Kyotanabe City Hall is also provided, although it doesn't operate very frequently.
sen.cmt: Shin-Tanabe, Kyotanabe City Hall のように変更しました。81→31に修正しました。

sen.j: 後者にはまずいったん新田辺方へ向かい、大住ヶ丘で分かれて、大住・松井を経由し、御幸谷・大芝へ向かう16・16Bと、松井山手から本郷を経由して金右衛門口で先述の2路線に合流する16A・16C・67D、そして本郷で別れ、摂南大学北口、松里を経由する30・31・31Aがある。
sen.e: For Kuzuha Station, the buses run at first in the direction of Shin-Tanabe, enter, at Osumigaoka, routes 16/16B or routes 16A/16C/16B, and enter, at Hongo, routes 30/31/31A: routes 16/16B - for Gokodani/Oshiba via Osumi/Matsui, routes 16A/16C/16B - merging at Kin'emonguchi into the two routes above via Hongo through Matsuiyamate, and routes 30/31/31A - via Setsunan-daigaku Kita-guchi (the north entrance to Setsunan University) and Matsusato.

For Kuzuha Station, the buses run at first in the direction of Shin-Tanabe, enter, at Osumigaoka, routes 16/16B or routes 16A/16C/16B, and enter, at Hongo, routes 30/31/31A: routes 16/16B - for Gokodani/Oshiba via Osumi/Matsui, routes 16A/16C/16B - merging at Kin'emonguchi into the two routes above via Hongo through Matsuiyamate, and routes 30/31/31A - via Setsunan-daigaku Kita-guchi (the north entrance to Setsunan University) and Matsusato.

For Kuzuha Station, the buses run at first in the direction of Shin-Tanabe, enter, at Osumigaoka, routes 16/16B or routes 16A/16C/67D, and enter, at Hongo, routes 30/31/31A: routes 16/16B - for Gokodani/Oshiba via Osumi/Matsui, routes 16A/16C/67D - merging at Kinemonguchi into the two routes above via Hongo through Matsuiyamate, and routes 30/31/31A - via Setsunan-daigaku Kita-guchi (the north entrance to Setsunan University) and Matsusato.

sen.j: その他に枚方市駅行きが約1時間1本、京阪東ローズタウンコミュニティバス循環線が1時間2～7本運行されている。
sen.e: In addition, buses for Hirakatashi Station run roughly once an hour, and the buses circulating the Keihan East Rose Town community are operated 2 to 7 times an hour
Additionally, buses for Hirakatashi Station run roughly once an hour, and the buses circulating the Keihan East Rose Town community are operated two to seven times an hour.
Additionally, buses for Hirakatashi Station run roughly once an hour, and the buses circulating the Keihan East Rose Town community are operated two to seven times an hour.

sen.j: 関西国際空港/大阪国際空港へのリムジンバスも運行している。
sen.e: Limosuine buses for Kansai International Airport/Osaka International Airport are also operated.
Limousine buses for Kansai International Airport / Osaka International Airport are also operated.
Limousine buses for Kansai International Airport / Osaka International Airport are also operated.

sen.j: 「リムジンセンターU-ハウス学研山手」は1996年4月17日に営業開始し、2003年～2004年頃までは現在のりそな銀行付近に位置していたが、現在はバスロータリー2番乗り場前に移転し、「リムジンセンターU-ハウス学研山手」と言う名称も使用されなくなっている。
sen.e: Operation of the "U-house limosuine center/Gakken Yamate" stop started on April 17, 1996 and was placed around the location of current Resona Bank until around 2003 to 2004, but the stop has now been moved to in front of boarding-place 2 in the traffic circle and the name of "U-house limosuine center/Gakken Yamate" has not been used.

The operation of the "U-house limousine center/Gakken Yamate" stop started on April 17, 1996, and was placed around the location of current Resona Bank until around 2003 to 2004, but the stop has now been moved in front of boarding-place 2 in the traffic circle and the name "U-house limousine center/Gakken Yamate" has not been used.

The operation of the 'U-house limousine center/Gakken Yamate' stop started on April 17, 1996, and was placed around the location of current Resona Bank until around 2003 to 2004, but the stop has now been moved in front of boarding-place 2 in the traffic circle and the name 'U-house limousine center/Gakken Yamate' has not been used.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約6,063人である。
sen.e: The number of persons getting on board at this station is approx. 6,063 a day in the fiscal 2006.
In fiscal 2006, the number of persons getting on board at this station each day was approximately 6,063.
In fiscal year 2006, the number of persons getting on board at this station each day was approximately 6,063.
sen.cmt: fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (From statistics of Kyoto Prefecture)
(From the statistics of Kyoto Prefecture)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)

sen.j: 付近に住宅やマンションが多いため、利用者は多い。
sen.e: Since many houses and condominiums are situated around this station, many users utilize it.
Because many houses and condominiums are situated around this station, many people use it.
Because many houses and condominiums are situated around this station, many people use it.

sen.j: また、快速・普通相互の乗り換え客も存在する（だが、当駅では乗換の際に階段の昇降が必要になる場合もあるため、上り方面の場合は一つ前の長尾駅で乗り換えた方が便利）。
sen.e: Some passengers change from rapid trains to local trains or vice versa at this station (however, since it sometimes occur at this station that passengers must use a stair, it would be better to use Nagao Station, the last stop before this station in the up direction).

Some passengers change from rapid trains to local trains or vice versa at this station (however, since it sometimes occurs that passengers at this station must use stairs, it would be better to use Nagao Station, the last stop before this station in the up direction).

Some passengers change from rapid trains to local trains or vice versa at this station (however, since it sometimes occurs that passengers at this station must use stairs when changing trains, it would be better to use Nagao Station to do so, the last stop before this station in the inbound direction).
sen.cmt: 上り→inbound としました。「乗り換えた方が便利」 の表現を追加しました。

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）3月11日 木津駅 (京都府)～長尾駅 (大阪府)間の電化開業にあわせて開業。
sen.e: March 11, 1989: Operation of this station started when the operation of portion between Kizu Station (kyoto Prefecture) and Nagao Statio (Osaka Prefecture) was electrified.
March 11, 1989: This station came into operation when the section between Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture) was electrified.
March 11, 1989: This station came into operation when the section between Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture) was electrified.

sen.e: Gakkentoshi Line (Katamachi Line)
Gakkentoshi Line (Katamachi Line)
Gakkentoshi Line (Katamachi Line)

sen.j: ■快速・■区間快速・■普通（木津方面はいずれの種別も各駅に停車）
sen.e: ■ Rapid trains ■ Regional Rapid trains ■ Local trains (in the direction of Kizu, all trains, regardless of their operation types stop at each station)
■ Rapid trains ■ Regional rapid trains ■ Local trains (In the direction of Kizu, all trains, regardless of their operation types, stop at each station.)
